constituent: podium, soil, dirt, ground, Churchill, top hat, -times, pent in, mouth, nightbreak, sun, day, one, floor
heisigStory: Soil/ground . . . top hat . . . -times . . . nightbreak. With kanji as difficult as this one, it generally pays to toy with the various connotations of its primitives before settling on one image. Aim for as much simplicity as you can.
koohiiStory1: A man on the podium announce the rules for the contest: You must fill a top hat with dirt as many times as you can by nightbreak.
koohiiStory2: Abraham Lincoln used a simple mound of soil for a podium, when he wore his top hat and gave the speech he had practiced many times until nightbreak. But it was so magnificent that no one noticed.
myStory: bục. nơi phát biểu, nhận giải. đất và vài lần vài canh khuya dưới mái nhà.
readingExamples: 壇上 (だんじょう), 花壇 (かだん), 文壇 (ぶんだん)
